title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: How to check status online on KFin Technologies, NSE, BSE - Upstox
summary:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: How to check status online on KFin Technologies, NSE, BSE

Publication Date: December 16
Source: Upstox

Introduction

The allotment of the ₹8,000 crore Vishal Mega Mart IPO, which was highly oversubscribed, is expected to be finalized soon, with investors eager to check the status online.

Key Points

  • The IPO was subscribed 27.28 times overall.
  • Qualified institutional buyers showed significant interest with an 80.75 times subscription.
  • Retail investors had a subscription rate of 2.31 times.
  • IPO listing date on BSE and NSE is set for December 18.
  • Price band was fixed at ₹74-₹78 per share.

How to Check IPO Status

On Kfin Technologies:

  • Visit the Kfin Technologies' IPO allotment status page.
  • Select one of the five server links.
  • If allotted, select the company's name from the dropdown.
  • Provide your application number, Demat account number, or PAN.
  • Complete the captcha and submit.

On NSE:

  • Go to the NSE IPO bid verification page.
  • New users must register.
  • Choose 'Vishal Mega Mart'.
  • Enter your application number.
  • Click on submit.

Conclusion

Vishal Mega Mart aims to serve the middle and lower-middle-income groups in India, operating 626 stores as of June 2024. Investors are anticipating the IPO allotment, which is crucial for the company's market entry.
newTitle: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment: How to Check Status Online

Stocks To Watch Today: RIL, Afcons Infra, Nazara Tech, Paytm, Swiggy and other stocks in focus on Dec 16

Publication Date: Updated Dec 16, 2024
Source: ET NOW News

The Gift Nifty suggests a flat start for Sensex and Nifty. The Sensex rose significantly on Friday, while several stocks are poised for attention today due to various acquisitions and orders.

  • Reliance Industries: Acquired a 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA for Rs 1,628.03 crore.
  • Bharat Forge: Acquired a 25% stake in Edgelab S.p.A for €2.5 million.
  • Aurobindo Pharma: Ordered to reverse ITC and GST payments of Rs 5.68 crore.
  • Lupin: Acquired three anti-diabetes trademarks from Boehringer Ingelheim.
  • Vedanta: Announcing its fourth interim dividend for FY 2024-25.
  • Paytm: Sold 5.4% stake in PayPay Corp to SoftBank for Rs 2,364 crore.
  • Dixon Technologies: Forming a joint venture with Vivo to manufacture smartphones.
  • JK Paper: Merging its three subsidiaries and acquiring a majority stake in Radhesham Wellpack.
  • HG Infra: Secured a Rs 862 crore order for highway construction.
  • Afcons Infrastructure: Received an LOA for the Rs 1,006.74 crore Bhopal Metro Phase 1 project.
  • Jaiprakash Power Ventures: Stay on penalties for illegal sand extraction.
  • Lemon Tree Hotels: Signed a new property in Bhuj, Gujarat.
Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only and should not be considered as any investment advice.

This article outlines significant movements and acquisitions in the stock market, suggesting potential investment interests for traders and investors.

Dhanlaxmi Crop Science IPO: Shares to debut today. Here's what GMP indicates - The Economic Times
summary:
Dhanlaxmi Crop Science Shares Debut 90% Above IPO Price

Publication Date: Monday, October 23, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

The shares of Dhanlaxmi Crop Science made a stellar debut on the NSE SME platform, listing at Rs 104.5, which is a 90% premium over the IPO price.

  • The company received a subscription of 550 times for its IPO, consisting of a fresh equity sale of 43.28 lakh shares.
  • Dhanlaxmi Crop Science specializes in developing and selling seeds for a variety of field crops and vegetables, leveraging over 18 years of industry experience.
  • The company integrates traditional breeding techniques with biotechnology to enhance product quality and yield.
  • As of September 2024, the company reported total revenues of Rs 119 crore and a net profit of Rs 8.2 crore.
“Dhanlaxmi produced seeds for 24 different field crops and vegetables, with cotton seeds contributing 95.64% of its revenue from operations.”

This successful listing reflects strong investor interest and highlights the company’s potential in the competitive Indian seeds market.
newTitle: Dhanlaxmi Crop Science Shares Debut 90% Above IPO Price

Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD holds steady below $2,650 ahead of US PMI data - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Stable Below $2,650 Ahead of US PMI Data

Date & Source: January 2024, FXStreet

Introduction: The gold price (XAU/USD) remains stable around $2,650 in early Asian trading on Monday. Central bank demand and geopolitical tensions are expected to support gold prices, while upcoming US PMI data could influence market sentiment.

  1. Gold price holds steady near $2,650 in early Asian trading.
  2. Central bank buying and geopolitical risks in the Middle East support gold prices.
  3. Investors await US December PMI data for market direction.
  4. Trump's tariff plan could cap gold's upside due to inflation concerns.
  5. Fed meeting on Wednesday expected to cut interest rates by 25 basis points.
Significant demand from central banks lifts the yellow metal price. Central banks have been net buyers of gold for nearly 15 years, emphasizing its value as a crisis hedge and a reliable reserve asset.

Conclusion: Gold prices are likely to remain supported by central bank demand and geopolitical risks, but Trump's tariff plan and Fed policy will be key factors influencing its movement.
newTitle: Gold Price Stable Below $2,650 Ahead of US PMI Data

summary:
GIFT Nifty down 100 points; here's the trading setup for today's session

Date: [Publication Date Unknown] | Source: Economic Times

The markets continued their positive momentum for the fourth consecutive week, gaining nearly half a percent ahead of key economic indicators.

  • GIFT Nifty traded lower by 98 points, signaling a negative start for Dalal Street.
  • Technical view suggests potential for the index to reach 25,000 in the short term, with support at 24,550.
  • India VIX fell, indicating reduced fear in the markets.
  • U.S. stocks showed little movement with mixed performances among major indices.
  • Asian stocks traded narrowly, influenced by regulatory stabilization efforts in China.
  • Oil prices eased as investors await signals from the Federal Reserve regarding rate cuts.
  • The U.S. dollar approached a three-week high with expectations of interest rate adjustments.
  • Foreign portfolio investors became net buyers, while domestic institutions sold shares.
  • The rupee settled higher against the dollar, helped by domestic market recovery.
Foreign portfolio investors turned net buyers at Rs 2335 crore on Wednesday.

In conclusion, GIFT Nifty is indicating a cautious start as traders await critical economic announcements.
